snippet: African and European leaders meeting in Malta this week are expected to adopt a package of support for countries that take back failed asylum seekers.
abstract: African and European leaders near agreement on 1.8 billion euro fund that will be used to make life better for potential refugees, encouraging them to forgo hazardous passage to Europe; gamble is aimed at stemming flow of thousands of refugees to Continent.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Valletta, Malta.

lead_paragraph: African and European leaders meeting in Malta this week are expected to adopt a package of support for countries that take back failed asylum seekers.

headline.main: Europe Banks on Incentives and Persuasion to Keep Migrants Home
headline.print_headline: Europe Tries Incentives and Persuasion to Keep Migrants at Home

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
